clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Treatment for Post-operative Gynaecological Pain With Dexketoprofen Trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo and Active-controlled, Parallel-group Study to Evaluate the Analgesic Efficacy and Safety of Dexketoprofen Trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride Oral Fixed Combination on Moderate to Severe Acute Pain Following Abdominal Hysterectomy

oversight_info.authority: India: Drugs Controller General of India
Lithuania: State Medicine Control Agency - Ministry of Health
Russia: Ministry of Health of the Russian Federation
Slovakia: State Institute for Drug Control
Ukraine: State Pharmacological Center - Ministry of Health

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is designed as a randomised, double-blind, active and placebo controlled, parallel-group study to be conducted in approximately 48 sites; to confirm the analgesic efficacy and safety of a fixed combination of dexketoprofen trometamol (DKP) and tramadol hydrochloride (TRAM).
Approximately 600 female patients presenting moderate to severe pain after a total/subtotal abdominal hysterectomy will be randomised to a total of 6 treatment arms. Each arm includes single and multiple-dose phase treatments, as follows: 1) DKP+TRAM/ DKP+TRAM; 2) DKP/ DKP; 3) TRAM/TRAM; 4) Placebo/ DKP+TRAM; 5) Placebo / DKP; and 6) Placebo / TRAM with a 3:3:3:1:1:1 randomisation ratio. The double-blind treatment period lasts for 3 consecutive days.
Main variables for analgesic efficacy are pain intensity by visual analogue scale (PI-VAS) and pain relief verbal by rating scale (PAR-VRS). Safety will be assessed by monitoring of adverse events and clinical laboratory tests.
Overall the study encompasses 3-4 planned visits at site, including screening, surgery and treatment period and final follow up visits.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: SPID8 (Sum of Pain Intensity Differences over 8 hours)
primary_outcome.time_frame: over 8 hours after the first dose
primary_outcome.description: Description Sum of Pain Intensity Differences calculated as the weighted sum of the PI-VAS (pain intensity measured by a visual analogue scale) differences

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of responders according to 50% max TOTPAR (Total Pain Relief)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of responders over 8 hours after first dose, according to the 50% maximum total pain relief rule: maximum TOTPAR calculated as the theoretical maximum weighted sum of PAR-VRS (Pain Relief - Verbal Rating Scale) scores

secondary_outcome.measure: SPID48 (Sum of Pain Intensity Differences over 48 hours of the multiple-dose phase)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: over 48 hours of the multiple-dose phase
secondary_outcome.description: Sum of Pain Intensity Differences calculated as the weighted sum of the PI-VAS (pain intensity measured by a visual analogue scale) differences over 48 hours of the multiple-dose phase

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of responders according to PI-VAS (Pain Intensity - Visual Analogue Scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: over 48 hours of the multiple-dose phase
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of responders (response defined as achievement a mean pain intensity measured by a visual analogue scale PI-VAS < 40 mm), over 48 hours of the multiple-dose phase

arm_group.description: Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol + Tramadol Hydrochloride - single dose phase Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol + Tramadol Hydrochloride - multiple dose phase
Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol - single dose phase Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol - multiple dose phase
Drug: Tramadol Hydrochloride - single dose phase Drug: Tramadol Hydrochloride - multiple dose phase
Drug: Placebo - single dose phase Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol + Tramadol Hydrochloride - multiple dose phase Arm type: single: PLACEBO comparator / multiple: experimental
Drug: Placebo - single dose phase Drug: Dexketoprofen trometamol - multiple dose phase Arm type: single: PLACEBO comparator / multiple: active comparator
Drug: Placebo - single dose phase Drug: Tramadol Hydrochloride - multiple dose phase Arm type: single: PLACEBO comparator / multiple: active comparator

intervention.description: One dose of Placebo during single dose phase (first 8 hours)
One dose of Dexketoprofen trometamol (DKP) during single dose phase (first 8 hours)
One dose of Tramadol hydrochloride (TRAM) during single dose phase (first 8 hours)

intervention.intervention_name: Dexketoprofen trometamol + Tramadol hydrochloride - single dose phase
intervention.description: One dose of Dexketoprofen trometamol + Tramadol hydrochloride (DKP+TRAM) during single dose phase (first 8 hours)
Oral dose of Dexketoprofen trometamol (DKP) every 8 hours during multiple dose (from day 1 to day 3)
Oral dose of Tramadol Hydrochloride (TRAM) every 8 hours during multiple dose (from day 1 to day 3)

intervention.intervention_name: Dexketoprofen trometamol + Tramadol Hydrochloride - multiple dose
intervention.description: Oral dose of Dexketoprofen trometamol + Tramadol Hydrochloride (DKP + TRAM) every 8 hours during multiple dose (from day 1 to day 3)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female patients aged 18 to 75 years.
- Scheduled to undergo a total or subtotal abdominal hysterectomy (with or without salpingo-oophorectomy) for benign conditions.
- Patients experiencing pain at rest of at least moderate intensity the day after surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients not suitable for study treatments and rescue medication (RM) or those for whom non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), opioids, acetyl salicylic acid, pyrazolones or pyrazolidines are contraindicated.
- Patients with clinically significant abnormalities in vital signs, safety laboratory tests and 12-lead ECG at screening.
- Patients with history of any illness or condition that might pose a risk to the patient or confound the efficacy and safety study results.
- Patients using and not suitable to withdraw analgesics other than those specified in the protocol.
- Patients using and not suitable for withdrawing any of the prohibited medication specified in the protocol.
- Breastfeeding women.
